_header: Man and woman in every place
_description: ‘Thank God that al hath sent’ — five quatrains (aaab) with this refrain, and burden: ‘Lefte owr hertes wiþ good entent / & thanke [g]od þat al hath sen’

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
Man & wo[mm]an in euery placegod hath ȝow sent vertu &
                    grace…
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines:
…Buxsumlych þou must a byd& thank god [þat al
                    hath sent]
BodEngPoete1.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Songs and Carols from a manuscript…of the Fifteenth
                Century.
Percy Society
         23. London: Richards, 1847: 37-8.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.

            1977: 227; 1977, 202.
